decision_conditions: <p>Cycle Parking</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, full details of</p><p>secure cycle parking for 64 cycles serving the residential component of the</p><p>development and 12 serving the retail component. Details should include</p><p>the layouts, foundations, stand-types and spacing of the cycle spaces as</p><p>well as details of showers/lockers for the retail spaces. The development</p><p>shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus</p><p>approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that a reasonable provision is made within the site for</p><p>the parking of bicycles in the interest of relieving congestion in surrounding</p><p>streets and improving highway conditions in general.</p><p>8.1.22Ecological Enhancements</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation</p><p>of the development. The development shall not be carried out otherwise</p><p>than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- Details for the installation of nesting boxes/bricks for small birds and</p><p>bats.</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development will not have an adverse privacy</p><p>impact upon the amenity of nearby uses.</p><p>REASON: In order improve the ecology and biodiversity of the site.</p><p>8.1.23Secure by Design</p><p>The proposed development, hereby approved shall achieve Secure by</p><p>Design accreditation, prior to occupation of the development</p><p>REASON: To ensure satisfactory accommodation standards and safeguard</p><p>against potential crime and anti-social behaviour.</p><p>8.1.24 Waste Strategy</p><p>Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, a refuse strategy</p><p>shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning</p><p>Authority. Refuse collection shall only be carried out in accordance with the</p><p>details thus approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local</p><p>Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To ensure the development is satisfactorily served in terms of</p><p>refuse collection and safeguard against the build-up of pollution.</p><p>8.1.25 Roof plant</p><p>No roof plant (including all external enclosures, machinery and other</p><p>installations) other than any shown on the drawings hereby approved shall</p><p>be placed upon or attached to the roof unless otherwise agreed in writing</p><p>by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is</p><p>satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of</p><p>the area.</p><p>8.1.26 Obstruction of footways</p><p>No doors or gates shall be erected in a way that enables them to be</p><p>opened over or across the adjoining footways, carriageways and rights of</p><p>way.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of public safety and to prevent obstruction of the</p><p>public highway.</p><p>8.1.27 Written Scheme of Investigation</p><p>No demolition to ground level or below or development requiring a new</p><p>foundation scheme at ground level or below shall take place until a stage 1</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>written scheme of investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved</p><p>by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the</p><p>WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in</p><p>accordance with the agreed WSI, and the programme and methodology of</p><p>site evaluation and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation</p><p>to undertake the agreed works.</p><p>a) The statement of significance and research objectives, the programme</p><p>and methodology of site investigation and recording and the</p><p>nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the</p><p>agreed works.</p><p>b) The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent</p><p>analysis, publication &amp; dissemination and deposition of resulting</p><p>material. This part of the condition shall not be discharged until these</p><p>elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out</p><p>in the stage 2 WSI.</p><p>REASON: To safeguard and protect archaeological remains.</p><p>8.1.28Sustainable Drainage</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, prior to commencement of the development, the applicant shall</p><p>submit full details of a sustainable drainage system supported by</p><p>appropriate drawings, hydraulic modelling, calculations and construction</p><p>details for the drainage system, for approval by the Local Planning</p><p>Authority in consultation with the LLFA. The sustainable drainage system</p><p>shall aim to achieve the greenfield runoff rates and must not exceed three</p><p>times the greenfield runoff rates as prescribed in the London Plan for all</p><p>return periods up to the 1 in 100-year storm events plus an allowance for</p><p>climate change. The development shall not commence until written</p><p>confirmation has been received from the LPA, confirming approval of the</p><p>surface water drainage measures.</p><p>REASON: In order to provide an adequate provision for Sustainable Urban</p><p>Drainage.</p><p>8.1.29 Drainage Management</p><p>Prior to the commencement of the development, a scheme for the provision</p><p>and implementation of flood resilient and resistance construction details</p><p>and measures for the site against surface water flood risk shall be</p><p>submitted to and agreed, in writing with the LPA in consultation with the</p><p>LLFA. The scheme shall be carried out in its entirety before the building is</p><p>occupied and; constructed and completed in accordance with the approved</p><p>plans in line with BS 8582:2013 code of practice for "surface water</p><p>management for development sites".</p><p>REASON: In order to provide an adequate provision for Sustainable Urban</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>Drainage.</p><p>8.1.30 Use Class E (a)</p><p>The non-residential floorspace in the development hereby approved shall</p><p>be operated only as Use Class E9(a) retail floorspace.</p><p>REASON: In order to protect the viability and vitality of the town centre.</p>

<p>No new pipes and plumbing</p><p>No new plumbing, pipes, soil stacks, flues, vents grilles, security alarms or</p><p>ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building unless as</p><p>otherwise shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is</p><p>satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of</p><p>the area.</p><p>8.1.12 Contaminated Land: Risk Assessment</p><p>No development shall commence until an assessment of the risks posed by</p><p>any contamination shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by</p><p>the local planning authority. This assessment must be undertaken by a</p><p>suitably qualified contaminated land practitioner, in accordance with British</p><p>Standard BS 10175: Investigation of potentially contaminated sites - Code</p><p>of Practice and the Environment Agency’s Model Procedures for the</p><p>Management of Land Contamination (CLR 11) (or equivalent British</p><p>Standard and Model Procedures if replaced), and shall assess any</p><p>contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>assessment shall include: a survey of the extent, scale and nature of</p><p>contamination; the potential risks to: human health; property (existing or</p><p>proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service</p><p>lines and pipes; adjoining land; ground waters and surface waters;</p><p>ecological systems; and archaeological sites and ancient monuments.</p><p>REASON: To protect human health, water resources, property and the</p><p>wider environment from harm and pollution resulting from land</p><p>contamination.</p><p>8.1.13 Contaminated Land: Remediation Scheme</p><p>No development shall take place where (following the risk assessment)</p><p>land affected by contamination is found which poses risks identified as</p><p>unacceptable in the risk assessment, until a detailed remediation scheme</p><p>shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning</p><p>authority. The scheme shall include an appraisal of remediation options,</p><p>identification of the preferred option(s), the proposed remediation objectives</p><p>and remediation criteria, and a description and programme of the works to</p><p>be undertaken including the verification plan. The remediation scheme shall</p><p>be sufficiently detailed and thorough to ensure that upon completion the</p><p>site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part IIA of the</p><p>Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to its intended use.</p><p>REASON: To protect the end user(s) of the development, any adjacent land</p><p>user(s) and the environment from contamination.</p><p>8.1.14 Contaminated Land: Implementation of Remediation Scheme</p><p>The approved remediation scheme shall be carried out [and upon</p><p>completion a verification report by a suitably qualified contaminated land</p><p>practitioner shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local</p><p>planning authority] before the development [or relevant phase of</p><p>development] is occupied.</p><p>REASON: To protect the end user(s) of the development, any adjacent land</p><p>user(s) and the environment from contamination.</p><p>8.1.15 Reporting unexpected contamination</p><p>In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the</p><p>approved development that was not previously identified it must be</p><p>reported in writing within 7 days to the Local Planning Authority and once</p><p>the Local Planning Authority has identified the part of the site affected by</p><p>the unexpected contamination development must be halted on that part of</p><p>the site. An assessment must be undertaken in accordance with the</p><p>requirements of the site investigation, and where remediation is necessary</p><p>a remediation scheme, together with a timetable for its implementation,</p><p>must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>Authority in accordance with the requirements of the approved remediation</p><p>scheme.</p><p>The measures in the approved remediation scheme must then be</p><p>implemented in accordance with the approved timetable. Following</p><p>completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme a</p><p>validation report must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local</p><p>Planning Authority in accordance with the implementation of the</p><p>remediation scheme.</p><p>REASON: To protect the end user(s) of the development, any adjacent land</p><p>user(s) and the environment from contamination.</p><p>8.1.16 Air Quality – Operational Phase</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation</p><p>of the development. The development shall not be carried out otherwise</p><p>than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>a) Details of independent air source electric heat pumps including low</p><p>temperature hot water boilers powered by the heat pumps;</p><p>b) An assessment of any changes in pollution levels at height / receptor</p><p>locations around the site and details of mitigation to protect future</p><p>occupiers from existing poor air quality.</p><p>REASON: To protect air quality and people’s health by ensuring that the</p><p>production of air pollutants, such as nitrogen dioxide and particulate</p><p>matter, are kept to a minimum during the course of building works and</p><p>during the lifetime of the development. To contribute towards the</p><p>maintenance or to prevent further exceedances of National Air Quality</p><p>Objectives.</p><p>8.1.17 Restriction of noise from plant and equipment</p><p>The rating level of any noise generated by plant &amp; equipment as part of the</p><p>development shall be at least 5 dB (A) below the pre-existing background</p><p>level as determined by BS4142 -"Method of rating industrial noise affecting</p><p>mixed residential and industrial areas".</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenity of nearby premises and the area</p><p>generally</p><p>8.1.18Privacy Screens</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>of the development. The development shall not be carried out otherwise</p><p>than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- Details of privacy screens on west elevation balconies.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development will not have an adverse privacy</p><p>impact upon the amenity of nearby uses.</p><p>8.1.19 Demolition and Construction Management Plan</p><p>Notwithstanding the documents hereby approved, no development shall</p><p>take place until a detailed Demolition and Construction Management Plan</p><p>covering the matters set out below only has been submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall</p><p>only be carried out in accordance with the details and measures approved</p><p>as part of the demolition and construction management plan, which shall be</p><p>maintained throughout the entire construction period. The plan must</p><p>include:</p><p>a) A demolition and construction method statement covering all phases of</p><p>the development to include details of noise control measures and</p><p>measures to preserve air quality (including a risk assessment of the</p><p>demolition and construction phase);</p><p>b) A Dust Management Plan to control dust emissions during demolition</p><p>and construction;</p><p>c) Details of compliance with ‘chapter 7 of the Cleaner Construction</p><p>Machinery for London: A Low Emission Zone for Non-Road Mobile</p><p>Machinery’ in relation to Only Non Road Mobile Machinery or used at</p><p>the development site during the demolition and construction process</p><p>along with details that all NRMM are entered on the Non Road Mobile</p><p>Machinery online register</p><p>at https://nrmm.london/user-nrmm/register before being operated.</p><p>Where Non-Road Mobile Machinery, which does not comply with</p><p>‘chapter 7 of the Cleaner Construction Machinery for London: A Low</p><p>Emission Zone for Non-Road Mobile Machinery’, is present on site all</p><p>development work will stop until it has been removed from site.</p><p>d) A demolition and construction waste management plan setting out how</p><p>resources will be managed and waste controlled at all stages during a</p><p>construction project, including, but not limited to, details of dust</p><p>mitigation measures during site clearance and construction works</p><p>(including any works of demolition of existing buildings or breaking out</p><p>or crushing of concrete), the location of any mobile plant machinery,</p><p>details of measures to be employed to mitigate against noise and</p><p>vibration arising out of the construction process demonstrating best</p><p>practical means.</p><p>e) Details of the location where deliveries will be undertaken; the size and</p><p>number of lorries expected to access the site daily; the access</p><p>arrangements (including turning provision if applicable); construction</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>traffic routing; details of parking suspensions (if required) for the</p><p>duration of construction.</p><p>f) A liaison strategy between the applicant and the adjacent school in</p><p>relation to the construction programme and means of mitigating the</p><p>environmental impacts of construction.</p><p>REASON: To avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the</p><p>public highway, in the interest of public safety and amenity, in order to</p><p>prevent the construction of the development having an unacceptable</p><p>environmental impact upon neighbouring properties and to protect air</p><p>quality, human health and to contribute to National Air Quality Objectives.</p><p>8.1.20 Delivery and Servicing Plan</p><p>The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until a detailed</p><p>Delivery and Servicing Management Plan has been submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details to be</p><p>submitted must include a stipulation that HGV deliveries do not occur on</p><p>Saturdays. Delivery and Servicing to the site shall only be carried out in</p><p>accordance with the details thus approved, unless otherwise agreed in</p><p>writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the</p><p>public highway and in the interest of public safety and amenity</p>

<p>SCB0 – Development in accordance with plans</p><p>The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed</p><p>strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any</p><p>subsequent approval of details.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out</p><p>in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.</p><p>8.1.3 SCB1 - Commencement within three years</p><p>The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than three</p><p>years after the date of this permission.</p><p>REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1) of the</p><p>Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended.</p><p>8.1.4 Details to be approved</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the</p><p>commencement of above grade works on site (excluding demolition works).</p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with</p><p>the details thus approved.</p><p>a) Samples of all external materials including brickwork</p><p>b) Details of balconies and soffits 1:10.</p><p>c) Details of doors and windows at ground floor 1:20</p><p>d) Details of shopfronts.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is</p><p>satisfactory and does not detract from the character and appearance of the</p><p>conservation area.</p><p>8.1.5 Sustainability - Green Roof</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the</p><p>commencement of the development. The development shall not be carried</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- Full details at 1:20 of a green / brown roof with subtract depth of</p><p>800mm, and maintenance plan</p><p>REASON: In order to ensure that the development is adequately</p><p>sustainable and to enhance biodiversity at the site.</p><p>8.1.6 BREEAM</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 12 weeks of the</p><p>occupation of the development. The development shall not be carried out</p><p>otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- A BREEAM post-construction assessment (or any assessment scheme</p><p>that may replace it) confirming an ‘Excellent’ rating (or another scheme</p><p>target of equivalent or better environmental performance) has been</p><p>achieved</p><p>REASON: To ensure the development meets the sustainability</p><p>requirements of the London Plan.</p><p>8.1.7 Air Permeability Testing</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation</p><p>of the development. The development shall not be carried out otherwise</p><p>than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- A full air permeability test report confirming the development has</p><p>achieved an average air permeability of 3.5 and 5 m 3 /h/m 2 @50pa.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of the promotion of sustainable forms of</p><p>development and construction.</p><p>8.1.8 Photo Voltaic</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation</p><p>of the development. The development shall not be carried out otherwise</p><p>than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- Certification by an accredited PV installer confirming that an array with</p><p>an overall capacity of at least 44kWp has been installed on the roof of</p><p>the development</p><p>Planning Sub-Committee - 2 June 2021 Agenda Item 7</p><p>REASON: In the interests of the promotion of sustainable forms of</p><p>development and construction.</p><p>8.1.9 Glazing</p><p>Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby</p><p>approved, full particulars of the following shall be submitted to and</p><p>approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the occupation</p><p>of the development. The development shall not be carried out otherwise</p><p>than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>- Detailed specification confirming the windows (without blinds) must</p><p>have a maximum g-value of 0.48 and that internal high reflectance</p><p>blinds (minimum solar reflectance 0.8) are to be installed in the south,</p><p>east and west windows,</p><p>REASON: In the interests of the promotion of sustainable forms of</p><p>development and construction.</p><p>8.1.10 Construction Materials</p><p>All insulation and refrigerant materials used for the development must have</p><p>a low (less than 5) Global Warming Potential (GWP) and Zero Ozone</p><p>Depleting Potential (ODP).</p><p>REASON: In the interests of the promotion of sustainable forms of</p><p>development and construction.</p>
description: Demolition of existing Class E(a) (formerly Class A1) retail units and construction of a part-three, part-four and part-five storey over basement building containing Class E(a) retail floorspace at ground and basement level and 25 Private Rented Sector residential units (Class C3) on the upper floors with related facilities, including plant and cycle parking.
